data.event: Founded on May 19, 1749 as Villa of Santa Bárbara, the town later became known as Ocampo in 1869.
Founded on May 19, 1749 as Villa of Santa Bárbara, the town later became known as Ocampo in 1869.

event.title: founded by Jose de Escandón on 19 May 1749

data.event: Population founded by Jose de Escandón on 19 May 1749 with the name of Santa Barbara, in the called site Tanguachín, place in that 460 Valley families had settled down, to that several rancherías indigenous added themselves to them.

event.title: The following year, the Mission of Igollo settled

data.event: The following year, the Mission of Igollo settled down, that congregated to natives of the groups pames and janambres, and was administered by the monk Francisco Escandón and Helguera, brother of the count of Fat Mountain range.
